meanings.definition: Extreme unwillingness to spend money or use resources.
meanings.sent1: Her parsimony was evident in her refusal to buy anything beyond the absolute necessities.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was due to its parsimony in managing expenses.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that Uncle Bob's parsimony was so extreme, he reused tea bags to save money.
meanings.sent4: His parsimony with words made his writing powerful and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The image of the old man counting every penny with meticulous parsimony stayed with her.

meanings.sent2: Her parsimony extended to turning off lights in empty rooms to save electricity.
meanings.sent3: The town's reputation for parsimony earned it the nickname 'Thriftyville'.
meanings.sent4: The artist's parsimony with paint strokes created a masterpiece of simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The image of the miser counting his coins with parsimony was a common sight in the village.
